level.text: 3122.1 The Director, on the Director’s initiative or on receipt of a complaint, shall investigate a funeral services establishment if the facts alleged would constitute grounds for disciplinary action under this chapter.
3122.2 A person may file a complaint in writing against a funeral services establishment.

3122.3 The Director may request a funeral services establishment under investigation to respond in writing to any allegations. If the Director requests such a response, the Director shall inform the funeral services establishment:
That the funeral services establishment is not required to respond to the request;
That a copy of any response may be sent to the complainant, if any;
That the failure to respond will not be held against the funeral services establishment in any subsequent action based on the investigation; and
That any response may be used against the funeral services establishment in a subsequent action.
The Director may send a copy of the funeral services establishment response, if any, to the complainant and request a written reply within a time period determined by the Director.
3122.5 After considering the facts of a particular case, the complaint, if any, and any response, the Director shall take one of the following actions:
Issue a notice of intended disciplinary action pursuant to section 3125;
Notify the licensee or applicant that particular deficiencies are required to be corrected within the period stated in the notice;
Refer the case to the Office of the Corporation Counsel for prosecution pursuant to section 19 of the act, D.C. Code, section 2-2818; or
3122.6 If the Director undertakes an investigation, the Director shall, within sixty (60) days of the completion of the investigation, take one of the actions listed in section 3122.5(b)-(e).
Source: Final Rulemaking published at 39 DCR 7853, 7864 (October 23, 1992).
